title: Cox Farms
description: Working farm with seasonal festivals, corn maze, slides, hayrides, and farm animals. Famous for the Fall Festival and Fields of Fear Halloween event.
parentHacks: The big slides are worth the wait - adults can go too!
Go on a weekday if possible - weekends are packed
Wear shoes you don't mind getting muddy
The corn maze has an easy path marked for little ones

title: Fairfax Ice Arena
description: Year-round ice skating facility offering public skating sessions, hockey leagues, and figure skating classes. Skate rentals available. Check schedule for public session times.
parentHacks: Call ahead to confirm public skate times - schedule changes often
Rental skates are included in admission
Bring thick socks - rental skates can be cold and uncomfortable
The snack bar has decent hot chocolate

title: Go Ape Zipline & Adventure Park
description: Outdoor treetop adventure course featuring ziplines, rope ladders, Tarzan swings, and obstacles. Two courses available: one for adults/teens and a junior course for ages 5+.

schedule.seasonalNotes: Weekends only in spring/fall. Closed Dec-Feb.

parentHacks: The junior course is perfect for kids 5-12 and includes supervision
Wear closed-toe shoes - no sandals allowed
Book weeks in advance for weekends
Bring layers - it's cooler up in the trees

title: Great Country Farms
description: Family farm offering seasonal pick-your-own produce, farm animals, hayrides, and a massive playground. Special events throughout the year including pumpkin patches and sunflower festivals.
parentHacks: The giant slides are worth the trek up the hill
Bring a wagon for hauling produce and tired toddlers
Arrive when they open to beat the crowds
Pack snacks - food options are limited and lines get long

title: KidScience Labs Fairfax
description: Hands-on science enrichment center offering classes, camps, and drop-in lab sessions. Kids conduct real experiments in chemistry, physics, biology, and engineering.
parentHacks: Drop-in sessions fill up fast - call ahead to reserve a spot
Kids get to take home what they make/create
Great option for birthday parties
Wear clothes that can get messy

title: Launch Trampoline Park
description: Indoor trampoline park featuring wall-to-wall trampolines, foam pits, dodgeball courts, ninja warrior courses, and a dedicated area for younger jumpers. Perfect for burning energy on rainy days.
parentHacks: Buy the special grip socks online beforehand - cheaper than at the door
Weekday mornings are much less crowded
The toddler area is separate and safe from big kids
Bring water bottles - they have fill stations

title: LEGO Discovery Center
description: Interactive LEGO attraction featuring rides, 4D cinema, building workshops, and millions of LEGO bricks. Designed for families with children ages 3-10.
parentHacks: Book online in advance for the best price - walk-up is expensive
Adults must be accompanied by a child (no solo adult visits)
The 4D cinema is loud - might scare sensitive little ones
2-3 hours is plenty of time for most families

title: Mosaic District Playground & Splash Pad
description: Modern outdoor playground and seasonal splash pad in the heart of Mosaic District. Surrounded by restaurants and shops. Free to enjoy.
parentHacks: Parking garage validates first 2 hours free with purchase
Ted's Bulletin across the street has great brunch
Bring a change of clothes for splash pad days
The playground has good shade coverage

title: National Museum of Natural History
description: World-renowned museum featuring dinosaur fossils, the Hope Diamond, live butterfly pavilion, and hands-on discovery rooms. Free admission makes it perfect for repeat visits.
parentHacks: The Butterfly Pavilion has timed tickets - get them first thing
Q?rius on the ground floor is perfect for hands-on exploration
Take the Metro - parking nearby is expensive and limited
Download the museum app for kid-friendly scavenger hunts

title: Reston Zoo
description: Small family-friendly zoo with farm animals, exotic species, pony rides, and a petting area. Educational programs and birthday party options available.
parentHacks: Pony rides are extra but the kids love them
Small enough to see everything in 1.5-2 hours
The picnic area is nice for packed lunches
Not much shade - bring hats and sunscreen in summer

title: Roer's Zoofari
description: Family-owned zoo featuring exotic animals from around the world. Get up close with giraffes, zebras, and lemurs. Feed animals and enjoy the petting zoo area.
parentHacks: Buy animal feed at the entrance - kids love feeding the animals
The giraffe feeding is a must-do experience
Weekday mornings are much quieter
Mostly flat paths - stroller friendly

title: Steven F. Udvar-Hazy Center
description: Explore the companion facility to the National Air and Space Museum featuring thousands of aviation and space artifacts including the Space Shuttle Discovery, a Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird, and the Boeing B-29 Superfortress Enola Gay.
parentHacks: Free parking lot fills up by 11am on weekends - arrive early
The flight simulators are extra cost but worth it for older kids
Pack a lunch - the cafe is pricey and limited

title: Zava Zone
description: Multi-level indoor playground designed for kids 12 and under. Features climbing structures, slides, ball pits, and a separate toddler area. Great for birthday parties and play dates.
parentHacks: Adults don't pay if they're not playing - just supervising
Socks required - they sell them if you forget
The toddler section is perfect for little ones away from big kids
Check for Groupon deals before you go

title: Toddler Storytime
description: Registration required. resenter: Marta Steenstra Davis Dolley Madison Meeting Room 1, Dolley Madison Meeting Room 2 Dolley Madison Library Welcome to Storytime! 18 months to 36 months. Build an early literacy foundation with rhymes, songs and stories for your toddler! Toddler Storytime is offered in two back-to-back sessions. Stories and activites are the same in both sessions. Space is limited. Registration is Required. Playtime begins at 11am after an encore storytime.

title: Black History Month Scavenger Hunt
description: Herndon Fortnightly Library Stop by the Information Desk to do a scavenger hunt about heroes in Black History and win a small prize.

title: Baby Bounce & Read
description: Tysons-Pimmit Meeting Room 1, Tysons-Pimmit Meeting Room 2 Tysons-Pimmit Regional Library Join us for songs, bounces, and stories for you and baby. Build an early literacy foundation while enjoying time together in your lap. Meets in person at Tysons Pimmit Library. Space limited to 25 children with one caregiver each. Entrance tickets are provided first come, first served at the Information Desk 30 minutes before the program begins. This class is best for babies 0 - 1.5 years (non-walkers).

title: Toddler Storytime
description: Centreville Meeting Room 1, Centreville Meeting Room 2 Centreville Regional Library Enjoy stories, songs, and fingerplays perfect for children ages 2 to 3 years old with adult. No registration. Space is limited. Please arrive early to receive a ticket.

title: Toddler Storytime
description: Registration required. Lorton Meeting Room Lorton Library Interactive Storytime with books, songs and movement for toddlers. Age 18-36 months with Adult. Registration required.

title: Toddler Storytime
description: resenter: Andréa F. George Mason Meeting Room George Mason Regional Library Watch your little one grow from baby to big kid in our early literacy-enhanced storytime with stories, songs and more. Ages 18 months - 3 years with adult.

title: Wonderful Ones Storytime
description: Pohick Meeting Room 1, Pohick Meeting Room 2 Pohick Regional Library Enjoy stories, songs and rhymes with an early literacy foundation geared towards ages 12-23 months. Participation is limited to 15 one-year olds with an adult on a first come, first serve basis. Tickets will be distributed at the information desk starting at 10 AM.

title: Baby Steps
description: resenter: Kings Park YS Kings Park Meeting Room Kings Park Library Are you looking for ways to help your new baby learn, grow, and socialize? Then come join us for early literacy activities, sing alongs, and rhymes designed with you and your baby in mind. This program encourages parent participation and child engagement. Ages: Birth to 18 months with adult. Space is limited to 16 kids with adult. Tickets will be passed out at the information desk 20 minutes before the program. Will begin promptl

title: Family Yoga
description: Registration required. resenter: Nora B. May Reston Meeting Room 1 , Reston Meeting Room 2 Reston Regional Library Come and enjoy yoga at Reston Regional Library! Learn about yoga poses and breathing techniques all while listening to stories and songs and playing games. Please bring a mat or a towel. This program is for ages 3 to 6; children must be accompanied by an adult. Registration is required.

title: Let's Get Ready for Kindergarten!
description: Martha Washington Meeting Room 104A , Martha Washington Meeting Room 104B Martha Washington Library This preschool storytime series incorporates playful activities that touch on all the early literacy skills that will help your child be ready to succeed in kindergarten. We will read, sing, talk, write and play together, focusing also on social-emotional learning as well as simply moving around and having fun. For children age 3-5 with caregiver If you have questions about the appropriate age for

title: Preschool Storytime
description: resenter: Marcia Jackson Oakton Meeting Room 1, Oakton Meeting Room 2 Oakton Library Interactive stories, songs, and action rhymes. For ages 3-5 with a caregiver. No registration or tickets required. Doors close when room capacity is reached.

title: Baby Lapsit Storytime
description: Registration required. resenter: Jennifer Schrott-Crisman Great Falls Meeting Room Great Falls Library Bond with your baby through songs, movement, and storytelling! Baby Lapsit Storytime is designed for the youngest learners - bounce along to fun songs, stories, and fingerplays all while building an early literacy foundation. Ages 0-18 months with adult. Sponsored by the Friends of the Great Falls Library! Registration encouraged, not required.

title: Toddler Storytime
description: Burke Centre Meeting Room 116, Burke Centre Meeting Room 117 Burke Centre Library Build your child's early literacy skills with stories, songs, and rhymes followed by playtime to develop their social skills. Ages 18-36 months with caregiver.

title: National Random Acts of Kindness Cardmaking Event!
description: Thomas Jefferson Meeting Room 1, Thomas Jefferson Meeting Room 2 Thomas Jefferson Library Celebrate National Random Acts of Kindness Day and make a card for a senior in our community or for someone you know! All cards will be donated to a local assisted living center. Ages 6 - 12. Supplies provided.

title: Sensory Friendly Time at Cub Run Rec Center Leisure Pool
description: Sensory friendly times at the Cub Run Rec Center Leisure Pool …

title: Snow Globe Art
description: Registration required. resenter: George Mason Regional Library Staff George Mason Meeting Room George Mason Regional Library Do you love the snow? Do you enjoy art? Open your imagination and create a winter wonderland scene at our winter snow globe craft program. All materials are provided. Ages For children ages 8-12 years old.

title: Fire Safety Bingo - Featuring a Visit from our Local Firefighters and Firetruck (If No Emergencies Arise)
description: Centreville Meeting Room 1, Centreville Meeting Room 2 Centreville Regional Library Winter is a wonderful season for cozy nights and family fun — but it’s also an important time to stay alert and prepared for emergencies. With colder weather and increased use of heaters and holiday decorations, now is the perfect opportunity to help children learn about fire safety and family escape planning. Let's learn the best ways to prevent a fire by playing Bingo. Can you solve our mystery safe

title: Paint a Basquiat Self-Portrait
description: Burke Centre Meeting Room 116, Burke Centre Meeting Room 117 Burke Centre Library Express yourself and paint a self-portrait inspired by one of the great American artists: Jean-Michel Basquiat! Learn about Basquiat's fascinating rise to fame, and how he transformed art with his distinctive neo-expressionist style. Then, use pastels, watercolor, collage, and more to create your own self-portrait inspired by this one-of-a-kind Black artist.

title: STEAM-Building Blocks
description: Lorton Meeting Room Lorton Library We provide the building blocks -- you provide the creativity! All Ages. No Registration Required.

title: Blue Bird Art Storytelling Event
description: Registration required. resenter: Rae Choi Oakton Meeting Room 1, Oakton Meeting Room 2 Oakton Library Want to learn how to become a published author? Come to Oakton library for a children’s book reading and storytelling program presented by three young authors. The student authors will read selections from their book, share their writing journey, and explain how they created the book and why they chose to write it. Blue Bird Art Foundation and Oakton library are providing a platform for cr

title: Read to Jackson
description: resenter: volunteer Great Falls Library Read to Jackson the therapy dog! Bring your own book or choose one from the library. Ages 4-12.

title: Kids Crafternoon
description: Centreville Conference Room Centreville Regional Library Stop in and get creative with some fun Winter crafts! For ages 3-12.

title: Paint Like Alma Thomas
description: Registration required. resenter: Jennifer M Schrott-Crisman Great Falls Meeting Room Great Falls Library Celebrate Alma Thomas, the first African-American woman to be included in the White House's permanent art collection! Paint a replica or paint in Alma's colorful style. Registration is encouraged, not required. Ages 6 - 11. Cosponsored by the Friends of the Great Falls Library.

title: Maple Sugar Days at Great Country Farms
description: Learn how maple syrup is made from tree to table! Watch live demonstrations of tree tapping, sap collection, and syrup boiling. Enjoy pancakes with fresh maple syrup and take home your own bottle.
parentHacks: The pancake breakfast is included and delicious
Maple candy in the gift shop is a great souvenir
Dress warm - you'll be outdoors watching demos

description: Vernal pools are one of our parks most fascinating and elusive…

description: Identify some of Fairfax County's common invasive plant species.…

description: Join us as we search for tadpoles, dragonfly nymphs and water…

title: Spring Into Action: All About Owls Campfire
description: Barred owls inhabit our stream valley parks. Learn to identify these…

title: Easter Eggstravaganza
description: The biggest Easter egg hunt in Northern Virginia! Over 20,000 eggs hidden across the farm. Meet the Easter Bunny, enjoy hayrides, baby animal cuddles, and spring activities. Egg hunts divided by age group.
parentHacks: Bring your own basket - they don't provide them
Check the egg hunt schedule by age group on arrival
The baby animals are the real stars
Book online in advance to guarantee entry

title: Baskets and Bunnies - Amusements Only
description: Celebrate spring with a full day of family fun and classic amusements. Tickets…

title: Baskets and Bunnies - Egg Hunt
description: Sign up for the egg hunt. Sessions include those for ages 1 to 4 years old and…

description: Enjoy a night hike to learn about nocturnal hunters. Listen to taped…

description: Collect your cosmic power in preparation for the 2026 Healthy Strides Heroes vs…

description: Teams of two compete in a 9-hole, best ball, stroke play…

description: Discover the beauty and importance of wetlands. Stroll forested paths and…

description: Teams of two compete in a 9-hole, best ball, stroke play…

description: Join the FCPA and community partners for a celebratory day of Asian culture and…

title: Family Fun Fridays
description: Spend your Friday exploring together at the Riverbend Nature Center. Family Fun…

title: Strawberry Jubilee
description: Pick your own fresh strawberries at the height of the season! Enjoy strawberry-themed treats, live music, farm animals, and playground fun. Strawberry picking included with admission.
parentHacks: Go early - the best berries get picked by noon
Bring sunscreen - not much shade in the fields
The strawberry shortcake is worth the extra cost

title: Spring Garden Plant Sale
description: Kick off the growing season at Green Spring Gardens with a community-favorite…

title: Spring Scramble Tournament (Tee Time Start)
description: Join us for a fun warm-up to your golf season. Teams of two players…

title: Spring Team Challenge (Tee Time Start)
description: Teams of two compete in an 18-hole best ball, scramble tournament…

title: Family Fun Fridays
description: Spend your Friday exploring together at the Riverbend Nature Center. Family Fun…

title: Sunflower Festival
description: Walk through acres of stunning sunflowers in full bloom! Cut your own sunflowers to take home, enjoy photo ops, hayrides, and summer farm activities. Perfect for family photos.
parentHacks: Early morning or golden hour for the best photos
Bring scissors or garden shears for cutting sunflowers
The fields are HOT in August - bring water and hats

title: Pumpkin Harvest Festival
description: The ultimate fall family experience! Pick your own pumpkins, navigate the corn maze, enjoy hayrides, apple cider donuts, and dozens of farm activities. Don't miss the giant slides and jumping pillows!
parentHacks: Buy tickets online to skip the line
Pumpkins are pay-by-the-pound in addition to admission
Bring a wagon to haul pumpkins and tired kids
The corn maze has an easy route marked for young kids
